dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 4330 IH: Ammo Identification Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Davis of Illinois introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to require serial numbers to be engraved on ammunition, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Ammo Identification Act of 2023.

subsection.text: Section 923(a) of title 18, United States Code, is amended by striking the first sentence and inserting the following: No person shall engage in business as a firearms or ammunition importer, manufacturer, or dealer until he has filed an application with, and received a license to do so from, the Attorney General..
Section 923(i) of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking (i) Licensed importers and licensed manufacturers and inserting the following:
by adding at the end the following:

Licensed importers and licensed manufacturers shall identify, by means of a serial number engraved on each item of ammunition, in such manner as the Attorney General shall by regulations prescribe, each item of ammunition imported or manufactured by such importer or manufacturer.

subsection.text: Section 923(g)(1) of such title is amended—

subparagraph.text: in the first sentence, by inserting and ammunition after firearms; and
in the third sentence, by striking or manufacturer and inserting , manufacturer, or dealer; and

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (B)(iii), by inserting or items of ammunition after firearms.

subsection.text: Section 923(j) of such title is amended in each of the 2nd and 5th sentences by inserting and ammunition after firearms.

section.text: The amendments made by this Act shall apply to conduct occurring on or after the date that is 2 years after the date of enactment of this Act.
